concept.deftn: a number that, as part of a well-defined scheme or convention, may be reliably referenced to recall or cite a resource

bestPractices.practice: This is field is optional and free-text.
This field can be repeated by clicking on the blue ADD another identifier button.
When entering an identifier, be sure to choose an identifier type from the drop down menu.
Selecting ISBN, ISSN, or WMO from the type drop down menu will cause those prefixes to be automatically entered into the identifier text box. Follow the prefix with the remainder of the identifier.
Enter the identifier, using digits, Roman numerals and/or letters as appropriate.
When entering EPrint numbers, please be sure to include any appropriate prefix, so that the source of the identifier can be determined.
Do not preface or follow the text with a number sign, 'Number,' 'No.', or any other generic prefixes.
If the type of identifier is not listed, use the notes field to indicate the type and to provide the identifier.
